summary.overview: The Word Counter application allows users to input text and receive real-time feedback on the number of words, characters, and paragraphs. Users can also set a character limit, highlight specific words, and save their progress using local storage.
summary.predefined_options: Default values for word, character, and paragraph counts are set to zero. The character limit input is optional and can be set by the user.
summary.external_resources: None specified in the provided code.
summary.external_js_libraries: None specified in the provided code.

requirements.description: When the user enters text into the textarea, the system should allow the user to input any text without immediate restrictions.
When the user clicks the 'Count' button, the system should calculate and display the number of words, characters, and paragraphs in the text input.
When the user clicks the 'Clear' button, the system should clear the text input and reset the word, character, and paragraph counts to zero.
When the user enters a number in the 'Character Limit' input field, the system should monitor the text input and change the character count display to red if the limit is exceeded.
When the user clicks the 'Highlight' button, the system should highlight all occurrences of the specified word in the text input by wrapping them in a span with a class for styling.
When the page loads, the system should retrieve and display the last saved text input and counts from local storage.
After any change in the text input or counts, the system should save the current state to local storage to preserve user data across sessions.
